required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Visual Performances of a Progressive Multifocal Intraocular Lens With Extended Depth of Focus
clinical_study.official_title: Retrospective Observational Trial on the Visual Performances of a Progressive Multifocal Intraocular Lens With Extended Depth of Focus

collaborator.agency: Opera CRO, a TIGERMED Group Company

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this observational, non-controlled, multicenter trial with a retrospective design is to evaluate the visual performance of one cohort of patients who received the EDOF MINI WELL® intraocular lenses following refractive lens exchange (RLE) or cataract surgery.

detailed_description.textblock: The study aims at evaluating the visual performance of the EDOF MINI WELL® in qualitative and quantitative terms of the progressive vision. The cohort of subjects includes all patients submitted in the six involved Centers. for the surgical procedure for cataract extraction or Refractive Lens Exchange (RLE) using the MINI WELL® with a pre-operative visit (from the day - 60 to day -1 before surgery) and a post-operative follow-up visit performed 30-60 days after implant.

primary_outcome.measure: Refraction; UDVA (Uncorrected Distance Visual Acuity); CDVA (Corrected Distance Visual Acuity); DCNVA (Distance Corrected Near Visual Acuity); Defocus curve; Reading speed; Halometry.

secondary_outcome.measure: Adverse Device Effects (ADE); Serious Adverse Device Effects (SADE); Unexpected Serious Adverse Device Effects (USADE); Adverse Events (AE); Serious Adverse Events (SAE).

study_pop.textblock: Patients undergone cataract or RLE surgery with the IOL MINI WELL and having a post-operative follow up visit (30-60 days) in the period from March, 1st 2014 to March,31st 2016.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Any gender and age above 18 years
- Refractive lens exchange (RLE) or cataract surgery
- Symmetrical preoperative keratometric astigmatism < 0.75 D
- Healthy corneas, not treated surgically
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous corneal surgery (i.e. pterygium, refractive surgery)
- Eye diseases with visual acuity < 20/32
- Pseudoexfoliation
- Abnormal pupil size and position.
- Use of contact lens 30 days before the preoperative visit.
- Corneal warpage

facility.name: Azienda Ospedaliero Universitaria Consorziale Policlinico di Bari
